COORDINATION OF FEDERAL ACTIVITIES TO ADDRESS ASTHMA-RELATED HEALTH CARE NEEDS. The Director of the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute will identify federal asthma-related programs, develop a federal response plan, and submit recommendations to Congress for improving coordination. The National Asthma Education Prevention Program Coordinating Committee will include a representative from the Department of Housing and Urban Development. The National Asthma Education Prevention Program aims to strengthen coordination of asthma-related activities within the Federal Government. A representative from the Department of Housing and Urban Development will be included on the coordinating committee. $5,000,000 from NIH funds will be allocated for the program from 2000 to 2004. SEC. 8. COMPILATION OF DATA BY CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION. The Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, in consultation with the National Asthma Education Prevention Program Coordinating Committee, conducts local asthma surveillance activities to collect data on asthma prevalence, severity, and management quality. This includes telephone surveys and health care facility specific surveillance. They also compile and publish data annually on the prevalence of children with asthma in each state and the childhood mortality rate associated with asthma nationally and in each state.
